baseline_groups.claim_summary: Cash-for-work treatment improves the composite mental health index among Rohingya refugees relative to control, by approximately 0.21 SD.
baseline_groups.notes: Primary outcome. Baseline uses camp and enumerator FE, controls for baseline mental health index and gender, clustered at block level. Coefficient 0.211 (SE=0.042, p<0.001).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Cash-for-work treatment improves individual mental health sub-indices (PHQ depression, stress, life satisfaction, sociability, self-worth, perceived control, stability) among Rohingya refugees.
baseline_groups.notes: Secondary outcomes. Each sub-index is a component of or related to the composite mental health index. Same specification structure as G1 but with outcome-specific baseline controls. Expected sign is positive because higher values indicate better mental health. Not all sub-indices are individually significant (e.g., selfworth_index p=0.108).

global_notes: Well-structured RCT specification search. 8 baselines correspond to main table (composite + 7 sub-indices). Most robustness specs target G1. Full-controls variants for sub-indices target G2. Individual PHQ items (phq_1 through phq_9) use raw depression items where negative coefficients indicate improvement. Some treatment variation specs change the treatment variable (cash_vs_control uses b_treat_largecash; any_vs_control uses any_treatment), which changes the causal object.
